videos.title: Gravel Riding in My 60s Didn’t Go as Planned—See What Happened!
videos.description:
Why are we still "racing" gravel bikes in our 60s? 

I was supposed to race the Kettle Mettle Medio this year—but illness had other plans. Instead, I grabbed my drone and DSLR and followed my wife Catherine and our friends Karen and Steph as they took on one of the most scenic and challenging gravel races in British Columbia.

In this video, I reflect on what it means to train—and stay active—in your 60s, the physical and mental benefits of gravel riding for older athletes, and why missing the race didn’t mean missing the point.

With stunning race-day footage, rider stories from the course, and honest reflections on aging, health, and endurance, this is more than a race recap—it’s a celebration of movement, resilience, and gravel cycling at any age.

🚴‍♂️ Featured Ride: Kettle Mettle Gravel Medio (~60km, 800m climbing)
🎥 Shot with: DJI Drone + DSLR
📍 Location: Okanagan Valley, British Columbia

Thinking about riding gravel in your 60s? This one’s for you.

#GravelRiding #KettleMettle #CyclingOver60 #GravelRaceRecap #activeaging

videos.title: Gravel riding in the beautiful Okanagan! Okanagan Graveller (OG) an epic ride.
videos.description: The Okanagan Graveller is back for a second year, brought to you by the same team that produces the iconic Okanagan Granfondo in Penticton. The event promises epic riding in the Okanagan’s stunning mountain terrain. Riders can choose from one of three distances on Sunday Big Okanagan Graveller BOG-200km, Big Little Okanagan Graveller BLOG -100km or the Little Okanagan Graveller LOG-50km with each distance starting and finishing at Kelowna Nordic Ski area. September 24th, 2023
